markdown: ... that you can explore places on OpenStreetMap using the [OpenStreetBrowser](https://www.openstreetbrowser.org/) app?

[1] [OpenStreetBrowser](https://openstreetbrowser.org) (OSB) is once again [online](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!pendingmsg/weeklyosm). Now you can easily search for POIs. The website shows a narrow menu on the left side, similar to common Wikis and the main page of OpenStreetMap.org although not static one. 20 languages are available.

![Text](http://www.weeklyosm.eu/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/367_EN.jpg =768x419)

Leisure, sport, shopping, educational services or public transport ... all in OpenStreetBrowser  [^1^](#wn367_15602) |  © [OpenStreetMap contributors](https://www.openstreetmap.org/copyright), [ODbL](https://opendatacommons.org/licenses/odbl/)

[Stephan Bösch Plepelits](https://github.com/plepe), author of [OpenStreetBrowser](https://openstreetbrowser.org/) [reported](https://blog.openstreetbrowser.org/node/48) in his blog that the pop-ups on the map have been significantly improved. A permalink will be available for the map in the near future.

[OpenStreetBrowser](https://openstreetbrowser.org/) now supports permalinks (as reported last week) which codes your current map position, opened categories and opened map objects. It is now easier to share data.

Stephan Bösch Plepelits [reports](https://blog.openstreetbrowser.org/node/50) on his blog, that the OpenStreetBrowser now shows excerpts from articles and images from Wikimedia Commons in the detail view. Wikipedia is found under the 'Special' menu item.

Stephan Bösch-Plepelits announces that [Openstreetbrowser](https://www.openstreetbrowser.org/) is back online. He [asks for help](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/dev/2018-January/030077.html) with creating additional categories of interest.

![Ausschnitt aus dem OpenStreetBrowser](http://blog.openstreetmap.de/wp-uploads//2018/01/openstreetbrowser.png =800x517)

Eine aktualisierte Version des OpenStreetBrowsers ist nun wieder online [^1^](#391_16770) | © [OpenStreetMap Contributors](https://www.openstreetmap.org/copyright) [CC-BY-SA 2.0](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0/)

OpenStreetBrowser [has](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk-at/2018-March/009437.html) a new [view](https://www.openstreetbrowser.org/#map=17/49.48166/8.47084&categories=gastro-smoking) that displays gastronomy POIs, with a different marker according to their smoking policy.

With the newest update, OpenStreetBrowser supports drawing patterns (e.g. arrow heads) on ways, which is now used on the [cycle routes map](https://www.openstreetbrowser.org/#categories=cycle_routes) and the [public transport map](https://www.openstreetbrowser.org/#categories=pt).
The cycle routes map gets the directions from the ways' role (forward/backward), the public transport map from the connection to the previous/next way (as defined in PT Schema v2). [read more](https://blog.openstreetbrowser.org/node/55). To prepare for the Christmas season, there's a new ["Christmas features"](https://www.openstreetbrowser.org/#categories=xmas) category.

[OpenStreetBrowser](https://www.openstreetbrowser.org/) now has a new category under "Leisure, Sport and Shopping". According to skunk's [blog post](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/skunk/diary/47066), the new category "Swimming and Bathing" includes all kind of swimming and bathing facilities and saunas.

OpenStreetBrowser has been updated to version 4.2. The new version allows its users to export visible map features as JSON, GeoJSON, and XML. As the project [reports](https://blog.openstreetbrowser.org/node/59) on their homepage, users with own repositories on OpenStreetBrowser Dev can now load categories from git branches and the broken Twitter feed in the news bar was replaced to show news from a blog instead.
[OpenStreetBrowser v4.3: Feature update](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/skunk/diary/47267)

[1] The website [openstreetbrowser.org](https://www.openstreetbrowser.org) received an [update](https://blog.openstreetbrowser.org/node/63) that makes more detailed filtering for buildings available and now includes filters by building attributes such as type, age or height. The new map version also introduced office tags in thematic maps and provides more detailed popups in the Culture categories.

![Logo](http://www.weeklyosm.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/01/443.png =544x413) 

Age of buildings in the city centre of Graz, Austria  [^1^](#wn443_19191)  | ©  blog.openstreetbrowser.org  © Map data OpenStreetMap contributors
openstreetbrowser.org's recent update [allows](https://blog.openstreetbrowser.org/node/65) you to filter category results by certain criteria. For example, you can now filter by Italian restaurants.

![lead picture](https://weeklyosm.eu/wp-content/uploads/sites/4/2019/12/488_T_EN.png =895x435)

Every single year - The map of the season [^1^](#wn488_21388) | © OpenStreetBrowser - Map data © OpenStreetMap contributors
... that the [OpenStreetBrowser](https://www.openstreetbrowser.org/#map

Skunks [blogged](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/skunk/diary/392029) about the update of OpenStreetBrowser to v4.7, which allows rendering of the offset and width of lines in metres, as provided by the real-world object, as opposed to pixels as found in (almost) all other map renderers to date. As an example he [mentions](https://www.openstreetbrowser.org/#map=19/42.70061/23.29762&categories=railway-gauge) railway gauges.

Stephan Bösch-Plepelits (user [skunk](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/skunk)) has [added](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/skunk/diary/398311) a new category to the [OpenStreetBrowser](https://www.openstreetbrowser.org/#memorial/n4596194056/details&map=17/49.75638/6.64341&categories=memorial). It now shows all [listed heritage objects](https://www.openstreetbrowser.org/#heritage/r1739171&map=17/49.76015/6.64614&categories=heritage) that are correctly [tagged](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:heritage) in OpenStreetMap. Stephan has also [created](https://www.openstreetmap.at/checker/) ![(de)](https://blog.openstreetmap.de/wp-uploads/2016/12/de.svg) > [![en](https://weeklyosm.eu/wp-content/uploads/sites/4/2020/09/en-green.svg)](https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=auto&tl=EN&u=https://www.openstreetmap.at/checker/) a web application that helps in tagging listed objects in Austria and Berlin, Germany.

![lead picture](https://weeklyosm.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/597_T_EN.png =925x465)

OpenStreetBrowser 5.0  [[^1^](#wn595_26034)] | © OpenStreetBrowser | map data © [OpenStreetMap contributors](https://wiki.osmfoundation.org/wiki/Licence/Licence_and_Legal_FAQ)

[1] After the recently accepted proposal for [`amenity=parcel_locker`](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Tag:amenity%3Dparcel_locker) (we [reported](https://weeklyosm.eu/archives/15194#wn599_26116) earlier), OpenStreetBrowser now [includes](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/skunk/diary/398522) parcel lockers.

![lead picture](https://weeklyosm.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/601_T_EN.png =835x467)

The recently approved proposal for [`amenity=parcel_locker`](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/DE:Tag:amenity%3Dparcel_locker) available in [[^1^](#wn601_26248)] | © [OpenStreetBrowser](https://www.openstreetbrowser.org/#map=12/39.4722/-0.3931) | map data © [OpenStreetMap contributors](https://wiki.osmfoundation.org/wiki/Licence/Licence_and_Legal_FAQ)
Stephan Bösch-Plepelits has [released](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/skunk/diary/400135) an update to OpenStreetBrowser, with new quality control categories.

![lead picture](https://weeklyosm.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/12/647_T_all.png =992x547)

OpenStreetBrowser: New category: Pedestrian footways [[^1^](#wn647_27816)] |  © [OpenStreetBrowser.org](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/OpenStreetBrowser)  | map data  © [OpenStreetMap contributors](https://wiki.osmfoundation.org/wiki/Licence/Licence_and_Legal_FAQ)

[1] Stephan Bösch-Plepelits (skunk) has [announced](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/skunk/diary/400541) there is a new footways category in OpenStreetBrowser. This shows footways, sidewalks (mapped as ways or tags on roads), steps and pedestrian areas. The overlay is [discussed](https://community.openstreetmap.org/t/openstreetbrowser-new-category-pedestrian-footways/6562) on the OSM community forum.

[1] GeoSDS team have [analysed](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/GeoSDS:_Mapping_of_Ambulance_Emergency_Response_Time_in_DKI_Jakarta) the emergency response time of ambulances in Jakarta, Indonesia, by using the [`emergency=ambulance_station`](https://openstreetbrowser.org/#map=12/-6.1745/106.8513&basemap=osm-mapnik&categories=custom/20101fa36f0ff594e786d441548cb6dd) tag in OpenStreetMap.

OpenStreetBrowser's maxspeed category now [shows](https://en.osm.town/@openstreetbrowser/113419602819143737) speed limit signs from zoom level 16, with icons that [adjust](https://openstreetbrowser.org/#categories=car_maxspeed) directionally to reflect the actual orientation of the traffic sign.
